We will focus on exporting our overhead conductors to key geographies, with the USA and Europe being our primary target market, followed by the Middle East and North Africa. We aim to capitalize on the market demand for products, particularly ACSR and Twisted Conductors, in the USA and export our ACCC conductors to emerging markets in Africa. We may pursue long-term supply contracts in Europe which will allow us to establish a presence in the European market and also increase our revenues from the supply of HPCs, as these value-added products offer high profit margins and align with global efforts to reduce carbon emissions and promote sustainable practices. We intend to accelerate our sales in the US and Europe markets and establish a presence in North Africa and the SAARC regions and emerging markets including Africa through a multichannel approach, including direct sales and distributors.

According to the CRISIL Report, the export demand of conductors has grown at a CAGR of 9.6% between Fiscal 2019 to 2025 and reached approximately ₹ 45 billion in Fiscal 2025 from ₹ 26 billion in Fiscal 2019 due to increased international demand. (Source: CRISIL Report) Several factors are expected to boost India's power conductor exports, including multilateral funding from organizations like the World Bank and International Bank for Reconstruction and Development for power transmission projects in regions such as Africa, Central Asia, South, and East Asia. Additionally, India's cost-effective manufacturing, driven by lower labor costs and a strong supply chain for raw materials like aluminum and copper, enables competitive pricing, making Indian conductors appealing to price-sensitive markets in Asia, Africa, and Latin America. CRISIL Report expects conductors to grow at a CAGR of 9% to 11% between Fiscal 2025 and 2030 and reach ₹ 67 billion to ₹ 77 billion in Fiscal 2030.
Source: Ministry of Commerce & Industry, Crisil Intelligence

We intend to strategically penetrate key geographies to expand our export footprint and enhance our global market presence. Our priority geographies include the European Union, Middle East and Africa, and Southeast Asia, followed by the US and Asia-Pacific regions. To achieve this, we plan to adopt a multichannel approach, leveraging direct sales, distributor networks, and partnerships with EPC firms. This strategy will enable us to effectively reach and serve diverse markets, ensuring broad market coverage and customer engagement.

According to the CRISIL Report, the exports of wire and cables grew to approximately ₹ 145 billion in Fiscal 2025 from ₹ 44 billion in Fiscal 2019, registering a CAGR of approximately 21.8%. This growth can be principally attributed to heightened international demand, particularly from organizations such as the International Development Association and the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development, which have invested heavily in transmission projects. Further, the export of wires and cables is expected to grow at a CAGR of 10% to 11% between Fiscal 2025 and 2030 and reach ₹ 230 billion to ₹ 250 billion in Fiscal 2030. (Source: CRISIL Report)
